intro: Pteronia xantholepis, commonly known as the yellow-leaf pteronia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in well-drained, sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial shrub that produces small, tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
